title: Helen Flanagan jokes she 'could have killed' fiancé Scott Sinclair when she was pregnant
text:
Helen Flanagan joked she 'could have killed' fiancé Scott Sinclair when she was pregnant as she candidly discussed life as a mother of two in a new interview.

The Coronation Street actress, 29, who shares daughters Matilda, four, and Delilah, 16 months with Scott, 30, opened up about the birth of her eldest child during an appearance on Giovanna Fletcher's Happy Mum Happy Baby podcast.

Discussing going into labour the first time with Matilda, Helen said: 'I was 11 days overdue having contractions, and he was like "do you not think it is all in your head?"

Candid: Helen Flanagan joked she 'could have killed' fiancé Scott Sinclair when she was pregnant as she discussed life as a mother of two in a new interview (above in June 2018)

The star said she called him 'all the names under the sun' before putting her own hospital bag in the car as Scott was 'doing his hair'.

Helen revealed that when they got to the hospital, she had yelled at the midwives to 'get him out', saying: 'I was looking at him thinking 'why isn't my mum here?'

'The second time wasn't much better. He looked a bit gormless, to be fair. They don't get it.'

Helen also discussed intimate details how she fell pregnant with Matilda, revealing she was conceived at her parent's home in Manchester, in the same room the star herself was conceived in.

Bumping along: Discussing going into labour the first time with Matilda, Helen said: 'I was 11 days overdue having contractions, and he was like "do you not think it is all in your head?" (above in May 2018)

She said: 'We were living with my mum and dad because Scott wanted to save on rent. We were living in my old bedroom.

'My mum went on holiday and said "make the most of it".

'I remember the day I conceived Matilda. Then Mum said "that was the room you were conceived in."

Oh dear: The star said she called him 'all the names under the sun' before putting her own hospital bag in the car as Scott was ' doing his hair' (pictured with daughters Matilda and Delilah in November 2018)

Helen went on to reveal that she and Scott - who have been together for a decade, now sleep 'top to tail' due to their children coming into the bed when they were younger, with Scott usually making way for them.

She said: 'He is just big in the bed and annoying.

'Maybe one day we will get round to sleeping next to each there but it makes me hot and sweaty.'

Baby: Helen also discussed intimate details how she fell pregnant with Matilda, revealing she was conceived at her parent's home in Manchester, in the same room the star herself was conceived in

The star also discussed how she adjusted to motherhood, saying she had lost confidence and become anxious initially over her beloved baby's arrival.

She said: 'Even though it was amazing just being this mum, I got quite bad social anxiety.

'No one would think that because you know, sure, you're an actress you can go talk to anyone… but no.'

Beloved: The star regularly shares updates on motherhood with her followers (pictured with Delilah in October 2018)
description: Helen Flanagan joked she 'could have killed' fiancé Scott Sinclair when she was pregnant as she candidly discussed life as a mother of two.
